author: Gazi Abbas Shahid
title: 'PM Modi Stopped World War III; Putin, Ukraine Look Up To Him For Guidance': Kangana Ranaut At Poll Rally | WATCH
text: []https://www.india.com/maharashtra/bjp-election-commission-maharashtra-congress-leader-vijay-wadettiwar-over-rss-cop-killed-hemant-karkare-remark-ujjwal-nikam-26-11-mumbai-terror-attack-ajmal-kasab-lok-sabha-election-2024-6906293/ By clicking â€œAccept All Cookiesâ€, you agree to the storing of cookies on your device to enhance site navigation, analyze site usage, and assist in our marketing efforts Cookies Policy . Lok Sabha Election 2024: Actor-turned politician and BJPâ€™s candidate for Himachal Pradeshâ€™s Mandi Lok Sabha constituency, Kangana Ranaut, has claimed that top world leaders, including Russian President Vladimir Putin as well as the people of Ukraine â€œlook upâ€ to Prime Minister Narendra Modi for â€œguidanceâ€ and he (Modi) is the reason that a third World War has not occured yet. â€œFrom Vladimir Putin to the people of Ukraine, they keep looking up to him (Modi) to provide them with guidance. And, perhaps this is a reason why World War III has not happened,â€ Kangana claimed while addressing poll rally recently. Ukraine looks up to Modi for guidance, It is because of Modi that World War 3 hasn't happened yet â€“ Kangana Ranaut [pic.twitter.com/KpDMYKjTfE] â€” Roshan Rai (@RoshanKrRaii) [May 6, 2024] The â€˜Tejasâ€™ actor asserted that PM Modi openly speaks in favour of world peace, and claimed â€œwe have never seen the image of India that we have today.â€ â€œDo we still need to think who we should vote for?â€ she asked. Meanwhile, Ranaut made a blatant gaffe at another election rally on Friday, mistaking her own party colleague Tejasvi Surya for RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav. Addressing a gathering in the Sundernagar area of Himachal Pradeshâ€™s Mandi on Friday, Ranaut â€” the BJP candidate from the Mandi Lok Sabha seat â€” while referring to the INDIA bloc, said the opposition alliance is full of â€œspoiled princesâ€. â€œBigde hue shehzadon ke ek party hai, chahe woh Rahul Gandhi ho jayen, jinhe chand mein aaloo ugane ho; Tejasvi Surya ho jayen, jo apni gunda-gardi karte hai, machli uchal uchal ke khate hai (There is a party of spoiled princes like Rahul Gandhi who wants to grow potatoes on the moon or Tejasvi Surya who does hooliganism and shows off while eating fish)â€¦,â€ Kangana said while apparently targeting former Bihar deputy chief minister Tejashwi Yadav, but mistakenly naming BJPâ€™s Bangalore South MP and candidate Tejasvi Surya. ðŸš¨ Exclusive Kangana Ranaut said that Tejashwi Surya does hooliganism and eats fish. BJP has made her its candidate, who doesn't know the difference between Tejasvi Yadav and Tejasvi Surya ðŸ¤£ [#KanganaRanaut] [#TejasviSurya] [pic.twitter.com/YN0UvuplOi] â€” Harsh Tiwari (@harsht2024) [May 4, 2024] Kanganaâ€™s faux pas became the fuel for humorous memes and jokes on social media as netizens poked fun at her for her â€˜slip of tongueâ€™. The blooper also triggered a response from Yadav on X. (With PTI inputs) For breaking news and live news updates, like us on India News on India.com .

title: Las universidades pÃºblicas pierden 300.000 alumnos en 30 aÃ±os, los que gana la privada
text:
Cerrar ventana emergente El nÃºmero de estudiantes de grado en las universidades pÃºblicas se ha desplomado en los Ãºltimos 30 aÃ±os en mÃ¡s de 315.000 alumnos, un descenso superior al 22%, que sin embargo ha han ganado los centros privados que han disparado sus alumnos pasando de los 50.000 que habÃ­a mediados de los aÃ±os 90 hasta los mÃ¡s de 300.000 actuales.
Madrid, AndalucÃ­a y Canarias, ademÃ¡s son las comunidades autÃ³nomas donde mÃ¡s ha crecido el nÃºmero de universidades privadas en la Ãºltima dÃ©cada, hasta sumar 13 nuevos centros madrileÃ±os y cinco andaluces y canarios.
Son datos de informe 'RadiografÃ­a del Sistema Universitario EspaÃ±ol' presentado este jueves por la FundaciÃ³n Conocimiento y Desarrollo (CYD) y que muestra que en EspaÃ±a hay actualmente 96 universidades, de las que 50 son pÃºblicas y 46 privadas.
Sin embargo desde 1991 el ritmo de creaciÃ³n se ha disparado en el sector privado: se han creado 14 centros pÃºblicos, el Ãºltimo, la Universidad PolitÃ©cnica de Cartagena en 1998 frente a 42 privados nuevos.
Madrid, AndalucÃ­a y Catalunya La Comunidad de Madrid encabeza la lista con 19 (6 pÃºblicas y 13 privadas), seguida por las 14 de AndalucÃ­a (9 pÃºblicas y 5 privadas) y las 12 de Catalunya (7 pÃºblicas y 5 privadas).
Con 9 universidades se sitÃºan Castilla y LeÃ³n (4 pÃºblicas y 5 privadas) y la Comunidad Valenciana (5 pÃºblicas y 4 privadas) mientras que Canarias tiene 7 universidades (2 pÃºblicas y 5 privadas), 4 Galicia (3 pÃºblicas y 1 privada) y 4 el PaÃ­s Vasco (3 privadas y 1 pÃºblica).
No obstante, casi ocho de cada diez titulados de grado (el 79,7%) procede de las universidades pÃºblicas frente al 20,3% de la privada, y en el nivel de doctorado los titulados de la pÃºblica rozan el 94%. En mÃ¡ster, sin embargo, las universidades privadas superan a las pÃºblicas con el 52,5% de titulados en el curso 2022-2023.
Si se analiza la distribuciÃ³n de los egresados de grado por estudio, en todos ellos hay un mayor porcentaje de titulados en las universidades pÃºblicas, especialmente en Ciencias (95,2%) e IngenierÃ­a, industria y construcciÃ³n (90,7%).
En el caso de las universidades privadas destaca el Ã¡mbito de EducaciÃ³n, con un 29,3 % de egresados, seguido por Salud y servicios sociales (23,9%).
Diferencias en la financiaciÃ³n En la pÃºblica la mayor parte de la financiaciÃ³n proviene de las transferencias del sector pÃºblico, que representa el 61 % mientras que para las universidades privadas la principal fuente de financiaciÃ³n son las matrÃ­culas que pagan los alumnos (78,9% frente al 12,3% de las pÃºblicas).
TambiÃ©n en las privadas pesa mÃ¡s que en las pÃºblicas la recaudaciÃ³n por matrÃ­culas de tÃ­tulos propios, como los de formaciÃ³n continua. En cambio, las universidades pÃºblicas superan a las privadas en ingresos de investigaciÃ³n (el 14,2% frente al 4,5% de las privadas).

author: S Sundar
title: Vijayakant | Fans near Rajapalayam tonsure their heads to pay homage to late DMDK leader - The Hindu
text:
Four fans of late DMDK founder Vijayakant in Rajapalayam, paid their respects by tonsuring their heads on Friday, December 29, 2023. Following the tonsuring, the four paid homage to the late leaderâ€™s portrait.
â€œCaptain Vijayakant is our sibling and we are performing the rituals for him, as we do for our family members,â€ said K. Arjunan (33), one of the fans, adding that they considered Vijayakant to be a family member.
Three others: Ramesh, Perumal and Kandasamy also had their heads tonsured. Arjunan got all of them all new shirts and dhotis, while the women of their families sang oppari (mourning song) to express their grief over the death of the actor-politician.
Wearing the new dhotis, the men paid homage to a portrait of Vijayakant with coconuts and bananas.
â€œWe are not very well educated. However, our parents have told us since our childhoods about all the good deeds of the Captain,â€ said Arjunan, who said all four men work as loadmen and are members of the DMDK Loadmen Association.
Arjunan also said that DMDK cadre and fans of Vijayakanth would continue with the good work that has been their leaderâ€™s legacy. â€œThe annadanam carried out by our leader will be continued by us,â€ he said.
